#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <string.h>

#define MOD 1000000007

// structure to represent adjacency list
typedef struct {
    int *edges; // array of integers
    int size;
    int capacity;
} adj_node;

long long dfs(int fro, int to, int f, adj_node graph[], int N); // forward declaration.

int main() {
    int N, K;
    scanf("%d %d", &N, &K);

    // Initialize adjacency list
    adj_node *graph = (adj_node*)malloc(N * sizeof(adj_node));
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        graph[i].edges = (int*)malloc(2 * sizeof(int)); // initial capacity 2
        graph[i].capacity = 2;
        graph[i].size = 0;
    }

    for (int i = 0; i < N-1; i++) {
        int a, b;
        scanf("%d %d", &a, &b);
        a--; b--;
        // add b to a's list
        adj_node *current = &graph[a];
        if(current->size == current->capacity) {
            current->capacity *= 2;
            current->edges = (int*)realloc(current->edges, current->capacity * sizeof(int)); 
        }
        current->edges[current->size++] = b;
        // add a to b's list
        current = &graph[b];
        if(current->size == current->capacity) {
            current->capacity *= 2;
            current->edges = (int*)realloc(current->edges, current->capacity * sizeof(int));
        }
        current->edges[current->size++] = a;
    }

    long long ans = dfs(0, -1, K, graph, N);

    printf("%lld\n", ans % MOD);

    // free allocated memory
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        free(graph[i].edges);
    }
    free(graph);

    return 0;
}

long long dfs(int fro, int to, int f, adj_node graph[], int N) {

        // Check if colorNum ever becomes negative? Not sure if possible but can add condition
        // But since K >= ... the parameters should satisfy?
    }
    return caseNum % MOD;
}
